newsitem.title: DUBAI: Iran, Pakistan sign marine border pact.
newsitem.headline: Iran, Pakistan sign marine border pact.

text.p: Iran and Pakistan have signed an agreement on demarcating their marine borders in the Gulf of Oman, the official Iranian news agency IRNA reported on Tuesday.

"Iranian Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Velayati and his Pakistani counterpart Gohar Ayub Khan in their meeting here on Monday night inked an agreement on defining the two countries' marine borders in the Gulf of Oman," IRNA said.

"The accord is designed to safeguard the marine interests of the two neighbouring countries and is expected to play a significant role in the exploitation of regional sea resources in addition to promotion of cooperation and regional solidarity," it added.
It said Iranian and Pakistani experts had in 1992 "prepared the draft of the accord based on international laws by taking into consideration the viewpoints of the two countries."
